intro: Oldenlandia mariannensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Oldenlandia mariannensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Hawaiian medicine.
